justification: Participants "could enter their (open-ended) response to the question ‘On what sentence do you decide?’", and these numerical responses (recoded to months) were analysed to determine whether high or low anchors biased the sentence length.

measured_by: final prison-sentence length (months) across order conditions
justification: The experiment "manipulated the order of final speeches" (prosecution first vs. defence first) and compared the resulting sentence lengths in months to test whether the first or the second anchor had greater influence.
